intro: Peperomia induta, commonly known as the velvet peperomia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a perennial plant characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and have a waxy texture. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. This plant is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its low maintenance requirements and ability to thrive in indirect light.
